Detailed Description

A virtual class that define the basic interface for stochastic activation functions. That is, activation functions that are based in a stochastic process.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

inline

A constructor.

Parameters
the_randa MTRand object for pseudo-random numbers generation

Member Function Documentation

void ANN::StochasticActivationFunction::multiplyDerivatives ( FloatGPUMirroredMemoryBlock *  units,
FloatGPUMirroredMemoryBlock *  input_errors,
unsigned int  size,
const ANNConfiguration &  conf,
bool  use_cuda 
)
inlinevirtual

An abstract method for compute derivatives of stochastic activation functions.

Parameters
unitsa memory matrix of size (size X bunch_size), represented in a FloatGPUMirroredMemoryBlock object. Its values are the neuron probabilities of being 1.0.
inputs_errorsa memory matrix of size (size X bunch_size), represented in a FloatGPUMirroredMemoryBlock object. Its values are the neuron probabilities derivative of the error that comes from the output.
sizean unsigned int parameter indicating the number of neurons on the corresponding layer.
confa reference to an ANNConfiguration object that contains global parameters as: current bunch size, maximum bunch size, use_cuda global flag, ...
use_cudaa boolean parameter to switch between CPU computation or GPU computation (using CUDA). Overrides the configuration stored at conf parameter.

Implements ANN::ActivationFunction.

References ERROR_PRINT.

virtual void ANN::StochasticActivationFunction::randomize ( FloatGPUMirroredMemoryBlock *  units,
unsigned int  size,
const ANNConfiguration &  conf,
bool  use_cuda 
)
pure virtual

An abstract method for apply the stochastic process over all neurons.

Parameters
unitsa memory matrix of size (size X bunch_size), represented in a FloatGPUMirroredMemoryBlock object. Its values are the neuron probabilities of being 1.0.
sizean unsigned int parameter indicating the number of neurons on the corresponding layer.
bunch_sizean unsigned int parameter indicating the number of layers. Each layer is composed by size neurons, and each layer comes from the computation of the forward of a different input pattern.
use_cudaa boolean parameter to switch between CPU computation or GPU computation (using CUDA).

Implemented in ANN::BinarySamplingActivationFunction.

float ANN::StochasticActivationFunction::sampleOne ( float  v)
inlineprotected

A method that samples 1.0 or 0.0 with probability v.

Parameters
va float which indicating the probability of being 1.0

References MTRand::rand(), and the_rand.

Referenced by ANN::BinarySamplingActivationFunction::applyActivation().

Member Data Documentation

MTRand* ANN::StochasticActivationFunction::the_rand
protected

A pseudo-random generator object for the stochastic process.

Referenced by ANN::BinarySamplingActivationFunction::clone(), ANN::BinarySamplingActivationFunction::randomize(), sampleOne(), and ~StochasticActivationFunction().
